author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 25-year-old M.Sc. graduate has been arrested by the Cubbon Park police for allegedly duping his 45-year-old Facebook friend by posing as a relative of Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

The accused, Niju Jayaram, befriended the woman, Veena, in December last when the latter posted a message on Facebook after losing her mother. In the first week of February, Niju met Veena and gave her a cheque of Rs. 2 lakh, asking her to use it whenever she needed money. However, Veena did not use the cheque.

On February 8, they met at UB City and from there went tot a phone showroom after Niju told Veena that he wanted to gift her a phone. After purchasing a phone worth Rs. 60,000, Niju claimed that he had forgotten to take his card and asked Veena to use hers. Veena did so as he promised to return the money.

Disappearing act

On the pretext of downloading a few apps, Niju took the phone and left the showroom, never to return.

He also did not attend to her calls later and when she tried to encash the cheque, it bounced.

She then approached the police, who tracked down Niju using his Facebook account and arrested him Friday. He is now in judicial custody.

Niju, a resident of Gowdanapalya, is a native of Chennai. He is not related to Ms. Jayalalithaa and is unemployed, the police said.
title: Man held for posing as Jayalalithaa’s kin and cheating woman
